channel.title: briefUpdatesMainNLbusinessAndMarkets
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from briefUpdatesMainNLbusinessAndMarkets, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Venezuela’s capital Caracas is unusually quiet with stores and gas stations closed, a day after Maduro was deposed by U.S.
item.description: A day before, lines wound through stores and outside gas stations as uncertain Venezuelans stocked up on goods in case turmoil broke out.

item.title: Rubio says the U.S. doesn’t need Venezuelan oil but seeks to deny adversaries control over it—and doesn’t rule out occupying the country
item.description: "What we're not going to allow is for the oil industry in Venezuela to be controlled by adversaries of the United States."

item.title: Route 66’s Big Anniversary Comes With a High-Tech Twist
item.description: If you think you know the iconic Route 66, also known as the ‘Mother Road,’ this digital project asks you to think again.

item.title: Venezuela Events, Jobs Data Set to Jolt Stocks as 2026 Kicks Off
item.description: S&P 500 company earnings are expected to have climbed 13 percent in 2025, with another rise of 15.5 percent in 2026.

item.title: Why Managing Expectations Could Make or Break Your Career
item.description: Expectations shape how we interact with our families. Our friends. Our bosses and our colleagues.

item.title: The U.S. military emerged as a big winner after Maduro’s capture. The other sensation is this Nike outfit
item.description: "Maduro looks like a man who was on Xmas break and wearing his Nike Tech Fleece for a third straight day."

item.title: Federal Employees File Complaint Against Trump Administration’s Ban on Gender-Affirming Care
item.description: Workers argue denying this care is sex-based discrimination.

item.title: What is the Monroe Doctrine? Here’s how it has shaped U.S. foreign policy for two centuries, including Trump’s ouster of Maduro
item.description: It was intended to ward off European colonization or other interference in the Western Hemisphere. In return, the U.S. also agreed to stay out of Euro...

item.title: The U.S. accuses Maduro and his wife of ordering kidnappings, beatings and murders, among other charges
item.description: Maduro’s wife is also accused of accepting hundreds of thousands of dollars in bribes in 2007.

item.title: The book that could change how kids learn about digital privacy

item.title: Data Shows the ‘Made in USA’ Brand Still Suffered Under Tariffs
item.description: Fewer shoppers are return customers of ‘Made in USA’ products. That’s because it still sends the wrong brand signal: expensive.

item.title: How leaders can use AI to get back on track after the holidays
